name: Eskaleh Nubian Ecolodge

reviews.title: Restaurant rave
reviews.text: We only went here for meals as we were staying elsewhere, but we went for lunch 2 days in a row and it was out of this world. Fabulous. The staff was wonderful. The lodge delightful. I highly recommend it.

The hotel only has 5 rooms - so book ahead! An expansion to double the size is in the works - so more people will be able to have this great experience. The staff was so friendly and welcoming. The meals that we had there were some of the best we had in Egypt. The bathrooms were definitely the best . The owner, Fikry, is originally from Abu Simbel, but spent many years studying and working in hotels in Europe. He returned to his home town to open this Nubian style eco-lodge to help preserve a culture that was devastated by the building of the high dam in Aswan.
reviews.title: This is the place to stay in Abu Simbel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staying a night in Aswan is worth it to see the colors of the sun on the temples at dawn. I would recommend going there for a night or two - especially if you can get a room at Eskaleh!
reviews.title: Quite lovely alternative in Abu Simbel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Out of the 10 hotels we had in our 3 week trip in Egypt, I rate Eskaleh highly as the most cosy and welcoming lodge. The lodge is in a pretty setting at the edge of Lake Nasser. My husband and I were quite charmed by the Nubian architecture and antique furniture. The dinner was delicious, healthful and nourishing albeit lightly spiced. The staff was gracious without any pressure for baksheesh (although we did leave a tip for the entire staff at the end which was much appreciated). All in all, we enjoyed our one night stay immensely.
reviews.title: Very nice, best restaurant,a bit pricey

reviews.text: The only aspect which needs improvement is the minimal breakfast which seems incongruent with the dinner.
reviews.title: Everything was great (but a bit pricey)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: An absolutely amazing place. Traditional Nubian lodge run by a family. Comfortable rooms and great food prepared fresh and served on the patio overlooking town. It's a delightful retreat from the noise and hustle that is the rest of Egypt. The owner is very knowledgeable about the area. Free Wi-Fi.
reviews.title: Beautiful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really enjoyed our stay at Eskaleh.
reviews.title: A great place in Abu Simbel

likes.liked: — You really feel like you are in egypt

reviews.text: We arrived there after a night trip Paris-Cairo-Abu Simbel. As agreed, we were picked up from the airport.
reviews.title: A Refreshing Cultural Interlude

reviews.text: We visited the temples in the morning, had a nap in the afternoon, went to the light show in the evening.
reviews.title: A Truly Authentic Experience
One of Egypt's best-kept secrets!
reviews.text: I would definitely stay there again on another trip to Abu Simbel !

We took a mid-morning flight on Egypt Air from Aswan to Abu Simbel on Sunday, January 4th. Upon arrival at the Abu Simbel Airport, we negotiated a taxi to the lodge and hotel pick up the next morning.
reviews.title: Authentic Experience

likes.disliked: — A little pricey given no full breakfast. No staff on premises overnight.

reviews.title: Highway Robbery
reviews.text: Our stay was a short, but wonderful experience. After a welcome drink of Karkade (hibiscus juice) and being warmly greeted by the proprietor and his staff, we enjoyed a delicious lunch in beautiful surroundings on the edge of Lake Nasser with views that stretch as far as the horizon with birds and hawks soaring above our heads with Fikry Kachif’s Nubian music playing in the background.

After walking a half-hour to and from the Temples and Light & Sound Show, we returned to the lodge for a wonderful dinner in the lodge’s dining room. We feasted on beef and chicken tagines with vegetables from their organic garden. Not only is the food delicious, but the service is good.
reviews.title: An oasis of calm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lodge is well-maintained and offers internet access and a library of books to read. Mosquitoes are ever present so the mosquito nets over our very comfortable beds were not just for esthetics! The décor is Nubian and offers an authentic experience.
reviews.title: Sincere as a head waiter's smile

likes.disliked: — The staff, and the unclear pricing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although staying at Eskaleh Lodge overnight to visit Abu Simbel should be on a list of things to do when in Egypt, we think, as other travellers have mentioned that for the price, staff should prepare a full breakfast in the early morning since many guests have early flight departures.
reviews.title: Make time to stay here

aka: Eskaleh Nubian Ecolodge Hotel Abu Simbel
description: Eskaleh ..... an Eco-Lodge Guest House , located a few minutes away from Abu Simble temples , marvelously overlooking the Lake Nasser, where Nubia was located. The hotel was built using natural materials such as Nile mud bricks. With a maximum capacity of 16 guest , Eskaleh ensures the best services for its guests in a relaxing , natural and warm atmosphere...
